ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Thamud denied in their excessive tyranny -
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: The Thamud denied (the truth) in their perverseness
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: In their presumptuous insolence the Thamud called the Truth a lie
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: The people of Thamud rejected (the truth) as a result of their rebelliousness
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: The tribe of Thamud denied with rebellion.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Thamud denied through their trans- gression.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Samood gave the lie (to the truth) in their inordinacy,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Thamood cried lies in their insolence
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: (The tribe of) Thamud denied (the truth) in their rebellious pride,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: The Thamud tribe rejected the truth because of their arrogance,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: The [people of] Thamud denied [Allah’s signs] out of their rebellion,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: The Thamud (people) rejected (their prophet) through their inordinate wrong-doing,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Thamud (people) denied (their Prophet) through their transgression (by rejecting the true Faith of Islamic Monotheism, and by following polytheism, and by committing every kind of sin).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Thamud denied [their prophet] by reason of their transgression,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [91:11]   Thamūd denied, their messenger Sālih, because of their rebellious nature,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (The tribe of) Thamud) the folk of Salih (denied (the Truth) in their rebellious pride) He says: their transgression led them to this.
